page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: The current{transport systems}are buses and private cars. The{railway}to Wigan runs past Carr Mill Dam, but there are no stations here. The most important road is the{East} {Lancs Road}which connects Liverpool with Manchester. In 15 mins (about 10.00 AM, after the rush hour) 357 {vehicles}(13% vans, 25% lorries, 62% cars) passed in both directions, with 38 going north on the{A58}towards the {M6,}and 39 going south on the{A58} towards St Helens through Blackbrook. {Clipsley Lane,}the main road through Haydock was much quieter with 65 vehicles in both directions in 15 mins. There are 5{bus routes,}to Billinge, St Helens, Liverpool, Ashton-in-Makerfield and Atherton.
